page.title: 13LANDSCAPE
page.content: The area is gently rolling with heights ranging from 154m at grid reference 5657 to 107m at 5957.To the north of Rainworth there lies about 1.5 square kilometres of Foresty Commission's mixed woodland,the remains of Sherwood Forest.Rainworth Water leads from L lake to Rufford Country Park pond.Although predominantly a coal mining area,only from the higher points are the winding gear & spoil heaps apparent.The Joseph Whitaker Comprehensive School built along with Lake View primary school on the C.L.A.S.P. system is a major building on the road between Rainworth & Blidworth the B6020.
